lead_paragraph: Adrian Aucoin scored the go-ahead goal early in the third period last night, and the Calgary Flames beat visiting Minnesota, 5-3, handing the Wild its first regulation loss in nine games this season.Minnesota earned 15 of 16 available points in its first eight games, winning seven times and dropping a shootout decision at Los Angeles.The Flames rallied after falling behind, 3-0, in the first 10 minutes.Jarome Iginla and Dion Phaneuf got the rally started with power-play goals in the second period, and Alex Tanguay tied the score later in the period. Aucoin gave Calgary the lead at 3 minutes 46 seconds of the third, and Robyn Regehr added a goal at 8:03. In other games: ¶The Washington captain Chris Clark scored his first two goals, and the Capitals’ juggled lineup produced the team’s highest output of the season in a 5-3 win over the visiting Tampa Bay Lightning. Alex Ovechkin had two assists and an empty-net goal with four seconds left to help the Capitals end a four-game losing streak.¶Eric Staal, Jeff Hamilton, Cory Stillman and Bret Hedican scored third-period goals as the Carolina Hurricanes defeated visiting Buffalo, 6-2, for their first victory over the Sabres since Game 7 of the 2006 Eastern Conference finals.¶Olli Jokinen scored twice to become Florida’s career leader in goals and points as the host Panthers edged the Philadelphia Flyers, 4-3. Jokinen’s first goal was his 355th point with the Panthers and his second goal was his 158th.¶Tomas Holmstrom scored his sixth and seven goals, and Matt Ellis also had a goal, as the Red Wings defeated the Vancouver Canucks, 3-2, in Detroit.
